alert.note: Alert for Bartow; Chattooga; Floyd; Polk (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 2:59AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Floyd, northwestern Polk, south central Chattooga and southwestern Bartow Counties through 330 AM EST ... At 258 AM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Waterhouse to Forney to Borden Springs, and moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Rome, Cedartown, Euharlee, Aragon, Cave Spring, Kingston, Taylorsville, Shannon, Pinson, Etna, Lindale, Esom Hill, Armuchee, Seney, Coosa, Holland, and Fish Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EST for northwestern Georgia. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 500 AM EST for northwestern Georgia.
